comments.content: Vonnes produced by The Font Bureau
I seem to remember it's called "Vonnes" and it's custom.
I think this is a version of Venus Sans by Font Bureau...
Whoops! Vonnes it is... Knew it was a "v" name.

You're right about Venus:

> * * *
> **quote:**
> 
> [...] There is, however, a very visible variant of Venus (including Venus Bold Extended) in use by Macromedia for their corporate identity. It is called
Boston magazine was using it at one time. I haven't see that mag for a while so maybe someone local can check. They used Vonnes and Miller.
where can I buy this font? -couldn't find it at Font Bureau...

You can't, unless you happen to know someone at either Macromedia or FB you could bribe.

> * * *
> **quote:**
> 
> Being a corporate commission, Vonnes is not available to the public.
> 
> * * *

Vonnes was briefly listed on the Font Bureau site a few years ago, and I called to ask about licensing it. They informed me that Macromedia had renewed its exclusivity deal through '05, as I recall.   
   
Venus is available from URW and Linotype:   
   
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/venus/](http://web.archive.org/web/20090801152057/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/venus/)   
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/venus/](http://web.archive.org/web/20090801152057/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/venus/)

Given the merger I wonder if this will be made available at retail? Perhaps the new company will adopt it and leave Myriad to Apple ;-)

Wow, a thread recycled from a year and a half ago!

I’m guessing that if it was a question of exclusivity for Macromedia versus Font Bureau being able to resell it to others, that Macromedia has no rights to resell to others.

That being said, it’s something I will be looking into in the next few weeks, as I assess Macromedia’s font assets (among other type-related stuff).
